thread.title: Kerry wins 'diplomat of the year' award
thread.title_full: Kerry wins 'diplomat of the year' award | Washington Examiner

author: Pete Kasperowicz
title: Kerry wins 'diplomat of the year' award
text:
Secretary of State John Kerry this week will receive the "Diplomat of the Year" award from Foreign Policy magazine, according to the State Department.
Kerry will receive the award Tuesday night at the Park Hyatt hotel in Washington, D.C., and will deliver on-the-record remarks to the press.
Kerry has been praised largely by Democrats for his negotiation and conclusion of the Iran nuclear agreement, under which Iran agreed to scale back its nuclear program. But most Republicans have pilloried the deal as one that doesn't force enough change in Iran, and also gives the country access to conventional weapons that could be used to threaten neighboring countries.
The State Department under Kerry has also been criticized recently for accusing Israel of terrorist-like actions as it counters violence from Palestinians.
  GOP senator to block Obama noms over co-op closures Sen. Ben Sasse said he plans to block every Department of Health and Human Services nominee.
By Robert King • 10/19/15 3:53 PM Last year, Foreign Policy gave the award to International Monetary Fund Managing Director Christine Lagarde, and in 2013, the award went to Deputy Secretary of State Bill Burns.

By Ariel Cohen • 10/19/15 2:28 PM
